div.div: Highlights & Important Notices

span.div: Join our Cardinal Family by registering for 5-year-old-kindergarten for the upcoming school year! Children who will be 5 years old on or before September 1, 2020, are eligible to attend this full-day program in our elementary schools for the 2020-21 school year.

span.p: The Fond du Lac School District will be offering a half-day, 4 year-old-kindergarten (4K) experience for our youngest Cardinals. Children who will be 4 years old on or before September 1, 2020, are eligible to attend for the 2020-21 school year.

a.title: Congratulations Sabish Middle School on Being Named a 2019-20 Title 1 School fo Recognition

div.a: Sabish Middle School Recognized as a Wisconsin Title 1 Beating-the-Odds School

span.div: For a fourth consecutive year, Sabish Middle School has been honored as a Wisconsin Title I School of Recognition.The School of Recognition award is presented to schools leveraging federal Title I funding to provide additional resources and services to economically disadvantaged students.

div.span: COVID-19 School Closure Information - INFO SERVICIO DE COMIDA COVID-19

span.div: In the Fond du Lac School District, the health, safety and well-being of our students and staff are our top priorities. With the recently elevated discussion regarding the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the news, we want to take a moment to reinforce preventive safety measures and reference our process and communications. View our webpage with further information.

div.h3: FAQs for Parents Regarding School Closure Due to Coronavirus

a.text-node: Haga clic aqu para obtener informacin en Espaol

span.div: Last updated April 8, 2020 at 2:28pm

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: First of all, we recognize what an unprecedented time this has been as the coronavirus has been evolving and changing our daily reality very rapidly.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The health and well-being of our students, staff, and families is a top priority.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In order to share what we do know at this time, we have created this list of Frequently Asked Questions for Parents.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If you need help during this time, please reach out to your teacher or call your childs school.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: More information will be shared as it becomes available.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;font-size:13px

span.div: Click to jump to a section:

div.strong: When/how will teaching staff be available throughout the day for when questions arise?

span.div: Staff will be available during the closure period via email and any other methods they determine and share with kids and parents. School offices will be open to answer questions during normal school hours from March 17-20th. Staff availability during future weeks will be determined based on the fluidity of the coronavirus.
How much time should parents and caregivers plan for each day to assist with remote learning of their student?

Students at the elementary level should anticipate 10-20 minutes of instructional time for math and literacy per day. Instructional time will increase by age. Parents/caregivers are encouraged to help their children develop a regular schedule and communicate with teachers when there are questions. Please check your email daily. Parents/guardians can view Family Resources for Remote Learning. (A Spanish version is available here.)

div.strong: What will 4K instruction look like during the District closure?

span.div: Staff is developing what remote/virtual learning will look like for 4K students and will communicate with families directly.

div.strong: Will Spring Break be cancelled? What about weather makeup days and summer days? Are we making up time at school during the summer days?

span.div: We will continue to update families as things develop. Spring Break will continue as planned on April 9-14, 2020. We will continue to provide food service on weekdays during Spring Break, except for Friday April 10, 2020. Two meals and Food for Thought will be provided on Thursday, April 9 due to there being no food service on 4/10/20. We will file for a waiver with the Department of Public Instruction to waive the hours of instruction requirement due to this ongoing public health situation. If granted, we would not make up the days we are missing. Our goal is to maximize the closure period with remote and online learning to the best of our ability.

div.strong: What are the expectations for learning for this week (March 17-20, 2020)?

span.div: Virtual/remote learning will start Monday, March 23, 2020, yet teachers can begin earlier if they so choose and all students can access the material. We aimed for March 23 in order to provide time for teachers to plan and work with families regarding internet access.

div.strong: What sources of instruction are we using?

div.div: Teachers will be communicating to their students what resources and coursework they are using for their class.

div.strong: How about getting materials if they were not in school on Monday?

div.div: Due to the Safer at Home Order by Governor Tony Evers issued on March 24, 2020, all Fond du Lac School District school buildings will be closed effective immediately until Friday, April 24 or until a superseding order is issued.TheDistrict Administration Center at 72 West Ninth Street will continue to be open and technology assistance will be available each weekday from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m at the District Administration Center.

div.strong: What are consistent school office hours to get materials?

div.div: Schools will be open this week - Tuesday, March 17 - Friday, March 20 during normal school hours. We will reassess subsequent weeks based on the fluidity of the Coronavirus situation.

div.strong: What about medications?

div.div: If youd like to pick up your child medication please do so on Monday March 16 or Tuesday March 17. If you are unable to pick up during the school day on Monday or Tuesday, please call your child's school to arrange a time for pick up.

div.strong: What if we do not have technology access in the home - such as no device or internet access? How will students do virtual learning?

span.div: We appreciate everyone filling out the technology access survey. High school students will be expected to bring home their Chromebook and cords. Middle school students will each be provided a Chromebook and cord. For 5K-5th grade students, a device and cord will be sent home to families. Technology devices will be distributed on Monday, March 16. If your child is not in school, please contact your childs school to arrange a pick-up time.

div.div: For families that do not have internet access at home, we encourage you to take the following steps:
First, visit theDepartment of Public Instruction (DPI) website to learn more about:

li.a: Offers for Services and Resources for Schools during COVID-19

div.div: Spectrum has created an interactive map where people can locate their Free Spectrum WiFi hotspots, it can be found here.

Second, provide your name and contact information to your childs school secretary, teacher or Principal. District staff will follow up with you directly to assist with securing internet access during this school closure.
We are making all reasonable efforts to support students with special considerations in terms of technology access.

div.strong: What if you have a device and internet access but are having problems accessing the virtual instruction?
div.br: Please contact your childs teacher if you are experiencing trouble accessing school materials. If your teacher is not able to resolve the issue, they will reach out to our technology staff for further assistance.

div.strong: What if a student is sick during the virtual learning time and cannot do the work, will they be able to make it up?

span.div: When they start feeling better, please work with your childs teacher to make up the work. This is an unprecedented event and we are working diligently to support all students with their virtual/remote learning needs.

div.strong: What about parents who are choosing to keep their students home already because of fragile health or concern about catching the virus?

span.div: As a parent/guardian, you make the final decision on whether your child should attend school. Please consult with your healthcare provider for their recommendations if you feel your child is at greater health risk from contracting the COVID-19 virus.

div.strong: What food services will be available for students? When, where, how (pick up/delivery, paid for)?

div.div:
Due to the closing of the schools, the Fond du Lac School District offering food service on weekdays during the COVID-19 closure.This weekday food service begins Wednesday, March 18, 2020.
Meals are FREE to every student and District children 18 years old and younger, including siblings that are not of school age. No registration is required.
Students will be served a FREE brown bag lunch consisting of a lunch sandwich, fruit, vegetable and milk will be served, along with a shelf stable breakfast for the next day.

Meals will be available on weekdays beginning Wednesday, March 18, 2020, from 11:00am-1:00pm at:
Fond du Lac High School Door 1 (Front Entrance)
Sabish Middle School Doors 2 & 3 (South Side Doors)
Riverside Elementary (Gym Lobby)
Parkside Elementary (Door at Parking Lot Near Gym/Cafeteria)
Boys & Girls Club of Fond du Lac (Front Entrance)
Fond du Lac County Fairgrounds (Aramark Vehicle)
Fond du Lac Public Library (Parking Lot) We will be handing out the meals outside. If the weather is poor, we will be handing them out just inside the noted entrances.
We are grateful for the many people and organizations in our community who are coming together to support each other during this time.

On Friday, March 27, 2020, Food for Thought will have 1,000 shelf stable meals for the weekend available for pickup at our seven food service sites.Thank you to the food service staff who worked very hard to prepare and distribute food.
Parents do not need to be present in order for children to receive their meals.

div.strong: How will students who qualify for free or reduced lunch be supported during the closure?

span.div: Lunches are free for all children 18 and under, including siblings that are not of school age, at the designated sites listed above.

div.strong: Will there be food service during Spring Break?

span.div: Spring Break will continue as planned on April 9-14, 2020. We will continue to provide food service on weekdays during Spring Break.

div.div: Families are encouraged to check their contact information in our Skyward system to ensure we are able to share timely messages through phone, email, or text. Here is a link to instructions on how to update your information.We encourage parents and students to continue to communicate through your childs teacher and principal as the primary forms of connection, communication and problem-solving.

div.strong: How will my student access special education service during the school closure period?

span.div: Katie Moder, Director of Pupil Services, will send a direct email (in English and Spanish) with more details to families using these services.

div.strong: How will my student access ELL services during the school closure?

div.div: In order to best serve our students receiving ELL services during school closures:

ul.li: Content teachers will communicate with ELL staff and include them in their virtual learning platforms and provide ways for activities to be accessible for students.
Newcomers will be given additional resources to continue language development at home by the ELL staff.

div.strong: Are school trips cancelled? (international, national, state) During what time frame are trips cancelled?

span.div: At this time, all student field trips and extracurriculars are cancelled during the state mandated closure (March 17-April 5). In cases where travel has been established with travel companies, we continue to work with teacher advisors and travel companies.

div.strong: What about athletics - practices, competing, seasons?

span.div: Starting March 17th, all athletic events are suspended during the state mandated closure.

div.strong: Music concerts- will they be rescheduled?

span.div: At this time, upcoming concerts at Lakeshore, Roberts, Chegwin and Waters have been canceled as has Band-O-Rama. The Middle Level Music Festival will be postponed in hopes of rescheduling. Any future concerts or music activities will be decided at the school level by the music teachers and administration as this fluid situation evolves.

div.strong: With the schools being closed, will child care centers be open?

div.div: We understand this state mandated closure will cause challenges for families. Please check with your local child care provider.

div.strong: Will child care centers (if still open) be prepared to help with school work/Wi-Fi access?

span.div: If you have questions regarding day care and what services are available, please ask your childcare provider.
If you are looking for additional community resources and support, please call 211 or visit their website. 211 connects people with thousands of nonprofit and government services in our area.
Below are a few additional community resources, however, there are many more that the United Way can help you locate through 211.

div.strong: Mental Health

ul.li: Comprehensive Service Integration - Student/Family Mental Health Supports
Mental Health America of Wisconsin - Adult Mental Health Resource

li.a: Fond du Lac County Crisis Intervention Services

ul.li: The Salvation Army of Fond du Lac(also has some personal care and cleaning items)

span.strong: Due to the Governor's Safer at Home Order, all Fond du Lac School District playgrounds are closed.

div.span:
ltima actualizacin el 26 de marzo de 2020 a las4:04pm
Hola padres, tutores y guardianes,
En primer lugar, reconocemos el momento sin precedente que estamos viviendo a medida de que el coronavirus evoluciona y cambia nuestra realidad diaria rpidamente.
La salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal y familias es nuestra prioridad.
Para compartir lo que sabemos en este momento, hemos creado esta lista de Preguntas frecuentes para padres.
Si necesita ayuda durante este tiempo, comunquese con su maestro/a o llame a la escuela de su hijo.
Se compartir ms informacin a medida que est disponible.
Dr. James Sebert
Superintendente
Preguntas frecuentes
Aprendizaje estudiantil
Cundo / cmo estar disponible el personal de la escuela a travs del da para cuando surjan preguntas?
El personal estar disponible durante el perodo de cierre por correo electrnico y cualquier otro mtodo que determinen y compartan con los nios y los padres. Las oficinas escolares estarn abiertas para responder preguntas durante el horario escolar normal del 17 al 20 de marzo. La disponibilidad del personal durante las prximas semanas se determinar en funcin de la fluidez del coronavirus.
Cunto tiempo deben planificar los padres y tutores cada da para ayudar con el aprendizaje remoto de sus estudiantes?
Los estudiantes en el nivel primario deben anticipar 10-20 minutos de tiempo de instruccin para matemticas y alfabetizacin por da. El tiempo de instruccin aumentar con la edad. Se alienta a los padres / guardianes a ayudar a sus hijos a desarrollar un horario regular y comunicarse con los maestros cuando hayan preguntas. Por favor revise su correo electrnico diariamente.Los padres / tutores pueden ver los recursos familiares para el aprendizaje remoto. (Una versin en espaol est disponible aqu.)
Cmo ser la instruccin 4K durante el cierre del Distrito?
El personal est desarrollando cmo ser el aprendizaje remoto / virtual para los estudiantes de 4K y se comunicar directamente con las familias.
Se cancelarn las vacaciones de primavera? Qu pasa con los das de clima y los das de verano? Estamos haciendo tiempo en la escuela durante los das de verano?
En este momento, la fecha de reapertura prevista es el lunes 6 de abril de 2020, que est sujeta a cambios ya que esta situacin es muy fluida. Continuaremos actualizando a las familias a medida que las cosas se desarrollen. No anticipamos un cambio en las vacaciones de primavera programadas del 9 al 14 de abril de 2020 en este momento. Solicitaremos una exencin con el
Departamento de Instruccin Pblica para renunciar al requisito de horas de instruccin debido a esta situacin de salud pblica en curso. Si se concede, no compensaramos los das que faltan. Nuestro objetivo es maximizar el perodo de cierre con aprendizaje remoto y en lnea lo mejor que podamos.
Cules son las expectativas de aprendizaje para esta semana (17-20 de marzo de 2020)?
El aprendizaje virtual / remoto comenzar el lunes 23 de marzo de 2020, pero los maestros pueden comenzar antes si as lo desean y todos los estudiantes pueden acceder el material. Apuntamos al 23 de marzo para dar tiempo a los maestros para planificar y trabajar con las familias con respecto al acceso a internet.
Qu fuentes de instruccin estamos usando?
Los maestros le comunicarn a sus alumnos qu recursos y cursos estn utilizando para su clase.
Cmo podemos conseguir materiales si el estudiante no estaba en la escuela el lunes?
Puede venir a la oficina de su escuela durante el horario de atencin para obtener materiales.
Cules son las horas regulares de oficina de la escuela para obtener materiales?
Las escuelas estarn abiertas esta semana - martes 17 de marzo - viernes 20 de marzo durante el horario escolar normal. Volveremos a evaluar las semanas posteriores en funcin de la fluidez de la situacin de Coronavirus.
Qu hacer con los medicamentos?
Si desea recoger el medicamento de su hijo, hgalo el lunes 16 de marzo o el martes 17 de marzo. Si no puede recogerlo durante el da escolar el lunes o martes, llame a la escuela de su hijo para concertar una hora de recogida arriba.
Acceso a la tecnologa
Qu sucede si no tenemos acceso a la tecnologa en el hogar, como ningn dispositivo o acceso a Internet? Cmo harn los estudiantes el aprendizaje virtual?
Agradecemos a todos los que completaron la encuesta de acceso a la tecnologa. Se espera que los estudiantes de escuela superior traigan a casa su Chromebook y sus cables. Los estudiantes de escuela intermedia recibirn un Chromebook y un cable. Para los estudiantes de 5k a 5to grado, se enviar un dispositivo y un cable a las familias. Los dispositivos tecnolgicos se distribuirn el lunes 16 de marzo. Si su hijo no est en la escuela, comunquese con la escuela de su hijo para concertar una hora de recogida.
Para las familias que no tienen acceso a Internet en el hogar, lo alentamos a que siga los siguientes pasos:
Primero, visite el sitio web del Departamento de Instruccin Pblica (DPI) para obtener ms informacin sobre:
Ofertas de servicios y recursos para escuelas durante el coronavirus (COVID-19)
puntos de acceso mvil inalmbrico
Spectrum ha creado un mapa interactivo donde las personas pueden encontrar sus puntos de acceso gratis de WiFi,se puede encontrar aqu.
En segundo lugar, proporcione su nombre e informacin de contacto a la secretara, maestro o director de la escuela de su hijo. El personal del distrito har un seguimiento directo con usted para ayudarlo a asegurar el acceso a Internet durante el cierre de esta escuela. Estamos haciendo todos los esfuerzos razonables para apoyar a los estudiantes con consideraciones especiales en trminos de acceso a la tecnologa.
Qu sucede si tiene un dispositivo y acceso a Internet pero tiene problemas para acceder a la instruccin virtual?Comunquese con el maestro de su hijo si tiene problemas para acceder a los materiales escolares. Si su maestro no puede resolver el problema, se comunicar con nuestro personal de tecnologa para obtener ms ayuda.
Enfermedad estudiantil
Qu pasa si un estudiante est enfermo durante el tiempo de aprendizaje virtual y no puede hacer el trabajo, ser capaz de recuperarlo?
Cuando empiecen a sentirse mejor, trabaje con el maestro de su hijo para completar el trabajo. Este es un evento sin precedentes y estamos trabajando diligentemente para apoyar a todos los estudiantes con sus necesidades de aprendizaje virtual / remoto.
Qu pasa con los padres que eligen mantener a sus estudiantes en casa debido a la salud frgil o la preocupacin de contraer el virus?
Como padre / tutor, usted toma la decisin final sobre si su hijo debe asistir a la escuela. Consulte con su proveedor de atencin mdica para obtener sus recomendaciones si siente que su hijo tiene un mayor riesgo para la salud al contraer el virus COVID-19.
Servicio de comida
Qu servicios de comida estarn disponibles para los estudiantes? Cundo, dnde, cmo (recogida / entrega, pagado)?
Debido al cierre de las escuelas, las comidas son GRATUITAS para todos los nios del Distrito de 18 aos de edad y menores, incluidos los hermanos que no estn en edad escolar, podrn participar en el programa de Servicio de alimentos los das de semana a partir del mircoles 18 de marzo. 2020. No se requiere registro.
A los estudiantes se les servir un almuerzo de bolsa marrn GRATUITO que consiste en un sndwich de almuerzo, fruta, verdura y leche, junto con un desayuno estable.
Los almuerzos para llevar tendrn un desayuno saludable para el da siguiente y estn disponibles de lunes a viernes de 11:00 am a 1:00 pm en:
Fond du Lac High School Puerta 1 (Entrada Principal)
Sabish Middle School Puertas 2 & 3 (Puerta en el lado sur)
Riverside Elementary (Gimnasio)
Parkside Elementary (Puerta en el estacionamiento cerca del gimnasio / cafetera)
Boys & Girls Club of Fond du Lac (Entrada Principal)
Fond du Lac County Fairgrounds (Habr un vehculo de Aramark -o- Boys & Girls Club en al estacionamiento principal
Fond du Lac Public Library(Habr un vehculo de Aramark -o- Boys & Girls Club en al estacionamiento )
Agradecemos a las muchas personas y organizaciones en nuestra comunidad que se unen para apoyarse mutuamente durante este tiempo.
Vamos a repartir las comidas afuera. Si el clima es malo, los entregaremos justo dentro de las entradas sealadas.
Este viernes, Marzo 27, 2020, Food for Thought tendr 1,000 comidas nutricionales durante para el fin de semana disponibles para recoger en lossitios todos de comida durante los horarios de servicio.Gracias al personal de servicio de alimentos que trabaj duro para preparar y distribuir alimentos.
Los padres no necesitan estar presentes para que los nios reciban sus comidas.
Cmo sern apoyados los estudiantes que califican para almuerzo gratis o reducido durante el cierre?
Los almuerzos son gratuitos para todos los nios menores de 18 aos, incluidos los hermanos que no estn en edad escolar, en los sitios designados mencionados anteriormente.
Habr servicio de comida durante las vacaciones de primavera (9-14 de abril de 2020)?
Las vacaciones de primavera continuarn segn lo planeado del 9 al 14 de abril de 2020. Continuaremos brindando servicio de alimentos durante la semana durante las vacaciones de primavera.
Educacin especial
Cmo acceder mi estudiante el servicio de educacin especial durante el perodo de cierre de la escuela?
Consulte esta ACTUALIZACIN de Katie Moder, Directora de Servicios Estudiantiles.
Apoyo para estudiantes del idioma ingls (ELL)
Cmo acceder mi estudiante a los servicios de ELL durante el cierre de la escuela?
Para servir mejor a nuestros estudiantes ELL durante el cierre de la escuela:
Los maestros de contenido se comunicarn con el personal de ELL y los incluirn en sus plataformas virtuales de aprendizaje y proporcionarn formas para que las actividades sean accesibles para los estudiantes.
Los recin llegados recibirn recursos adicionales para continuar con el desarrollo del lenguaje en el hogar por parte del personal de ELL.
Extracurriculares / Excursiones
Se cancelan los viajes escolares? (internacional, nacional, estatal) Durante qu perodo de tiempo se cancelan los viajes?
En este momento, todas las excursiones y actividades extracurriculares de los estudiantes se cancelan durante el cierre obligatorio del estado (del 17 de marzo al 5 de abril). En los casos en que se han establecido viajes con compaas de viajes, continuamos trabajando con asesores docentes y compaas de viajes.
Qu pasa con el atletismo: prcticas, competencias, temporadas?
A partir del 17 de marzo, todos los eventos deportivos se suspenden durante el cierre ordenado por el estado.
Conciertos de msica: se reprogramarn?
En este momento, los prximos conciertos en Lakeshore, Roberts, Chegwin y Waters han sido cancelados al igual que Band-O-Rama. El Festival de Msica de Nivel Medio se pospondr con la esperanza de reprogramarlo. Los futuros conciertos o actividades musicales sern decididos a nivel escolar por los maestros de msica y la administracin a medida que esta situacin fluida evolucione.
Guardera
Con el cierre de las escuelas, estarn abiertos los centros de cuidado infantil?
Entendemos que este cierre obligatorio del estado causar desafos para las familias. Consulte con su proveedor local de cuidado infantil.
Los centros de cuidado infantil (si an estn abiertos) estarn preparados para ayudar con el trabajo escolar / acceso WiFi?
Entendemos que este cierre obligatorio del estado causar muchos desafos para las familias. Si tiene preguntas sobre la guardera y los servicios disponibles, consulte a su proveedor.
Recursos de la comunidad
Todos los siguientes enlaces se traducen fcilmente usando Google Translate con un clic derecho del mouse. Estos son solo algunos de los recursos comunitarios adicionales que estn disponibles. Hay muchos ms. La organizacion elUnited Way le puede ayudar a localizarlos. Solo hay de marcar 211.
Salud Mental
La integracin de servicios integrales, Comprehensive Service Integration (CSI) - Apoyo para la salud mental de estudiantes y familias
La Salud Mental Estadounidense de Wisconsin, Mental Health America of Wisconsin - Recursos de salud mental para adultos Servicios
Servicios De Intervencin Del Condado de Fond du Lac,Fond du Lac County Crisis Intervention Services
Recursos Para el Aprendizaje Social y Emocional
Servicios De Alimentos (ms all de los servicios de nutricin de las escuelas)
La Despensa De Comida De Fond du Lac, The Fond du Lac Food Pantry
El Ejrcito de Salvacin de Fond du Lac,The Salvation Army of Fond du Lac (tambin tienen algunos artculos de limpieza y cuidado personal)
Vivienda y servicios pblicos
La Corporacin De Servicios De Avance, Forward Service Corporation
